loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es: Francisco Javier tiene 46 años de edad, el trabaja como vigilante en una de la empresas privada de la localidad, en esta  profesión a la que se dedica ya tiene varios años de ejercerla, él tiene tres hijos que están a su cargo sus hijos esta estudiante junto con su esposa luchan por sacar a sus hijos adelante brindándole lo mejor. Francisco compro su vivienda con mucho esfuerzos y la ha acondicionado pero con el salario que gana no le cubre para realizar las remodelaciones que se necesita hacerle, él está solicitando financiamiento para realizarla lo cual comprara con el crédito bloque, cemento, arena, perlines entre otros materiales de construcción.
texts.en:
Friancisco Javier is 46 years old, he works as a guard in one of the private firms in the area. He has made a living in this way for various years. He has three children who are in his care, who are studying. Together with his wife they struggle to help their children get ahead by providing the best for them. 

Francisco bought his property with a lot of hard work and he has renovated it but with the salary he earns he does not have enough to carry out necessary refurbishments. He is requesting a loan to do this, by buying blocks, cement, sand, perlins and other construction materials with the loan.

loans.use: to buy blocks, cement, sand, perlins and other construction materials.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 24-year-old married man. He has 2 children who are 3 and 7 years of age. He describes himself as God-fearing and honest. 

David operates a carpentry workshop and retail store where he sells wardrobes and sofa sets. He has been in this business for 12 years. His business is located in a strategic area and his primary customers are local residents. He says his biggest business challenge is a shortage of wood. 

David will use the 20,000 KES loan to purchase timber to make more furniture to sell. His business goal is to own machines that make furniture, within 5 years. David's hopes that in the future, he can build a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy timber to make furniture for sale.

loans.name: Geradio

texts.en:
25-year-old Geradio is a married man with a seven-year-old child. He lives in the town of Trinidad, Bohol with his family.

Geradio runs an auto repair shop. He is able to provide for his family with his income. Five months ago, he started a sari-sari store business to help improve his income. He sells items like spices, coffee, eggs and soft drinks. 

Geradio works hard to support his family and sustain his child's education. It is his dream to have his child finish college and have a bright future.

Geradio has requested this loan to buy more items to sell, such as soft drinks, rice and canned goods. He hopes for this loan to help grow his sari-sari store business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell, such as soft drinks, rice and canned goods.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell to her customers

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es: Juana, originaria de León de oficio  comerciante, dueña de una prospera pulpería la cual atravez del préstamo Kiva, ha venido surgiendo poco a poco el primer préstamo le fue de gran ayuda para surtir su pulpería de nuevos y mejores productos de mucha necesidad en su vecindario . Ahora requiere un segundo crédito para comprar mochilas, cuadernos, lápices y material para la escuela también invertir en compras de granos básicos y gaseosas para vender en su negocio. Uno de sus planes es ir mejorando su casa y comprar estantes y vitrinas para exhibir productos en su pulpería.
texts.en:
Juana, originally from León, is a merchant. She own a prosperous general store which, through a Kiva loan,has slowly grown. Her first loan was very helpful in stocking her general store with much needed products for the neighbourhood. 

Now she requires a second loan to buy backpacks, notebooks, pencils and school materials, as well as investing in buying basic grains and sodas to sell in her business. One of her plans is to improve her house and to buy shelves and glass cabinets to display her products in her general store.

loans.use: to buy backpacks, notebooks, pencils and school materials, as well as investing in buying basic grains and sodas.

loans.name: Maya

texts.en:
Maya is 48 years ago. She lives in the village of Lemshveniera, East Georgia. Maya is married and lives with her family: husband Germane, three sons (25, 23 and 21 years old) and her 20-year-old daughter. 

Maya heads the family's agricultural business, which is their main source of income. Her sons help her. The family owns a small dairy farm. Maya produces traditional Georgian cheese and sells it locally. The family's total average monthly income is 1000 Laris. 

Maya requested credit to purchase furniture for the family. She will place it in the kitchen and living room. The living conditions of the family will improve and family members will be able to spend evenings after hard working days in a more comfortable family environment.

loans.use: to purchase furniture

loans.name: White Group

texts.en:
Husein, who is in his early 30s, is married with one small child. He has been running two businesses, a retail shop and library, for three years now. He works from 8:00 am to 9:00 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This will be his 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to start the library business and has paid back all his loans successfully. He wants a loan to increase the library stock by buying more CDs, DVDs, and video tapes. His dream is to one day be able to build his own house.

He will share this loan with his loan group "white" which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: to increase the library stock

loans.name: Coka Group

texts.en:
The borrower, who is in late 60's, is married and has nine children, some of whom still attend school.  He has been running a hotel and guesthouse business since 2005.  He works 24 hours a day and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This will be his third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loan to pay household expenses and school fees.  He wants to use this loan to modify the building by painting new colors and replacing floor tiles.   His dream is to open a car show room one day.  

He will share this loan with his loan group, "COKA," which has a total of 20 members who will hold each other accountable to pay back their loans.

loans.use: to expand his hotel business.

loans.name: Kirua Group

texts.en:
Athumani, who is in his mid 30s is married with one small son.  He has been running a business of selling food for 10 years now.  He works from 10.00 am to midnight and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be his 7th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to buy a fridge, build a small place in the market for selling his food and has paid back all his loans successfully.  He wants a loan to buy a sack of Irish potatoes, some pieces of chicken, 10kilos of meat and to increase stock on the soft drinks to sell. His dream is to one day be able to start poultry.

He will this loan with his loan group "Kirua" which has a total of 16 members who will hold each other accountable is paying beck their loans.

loans.use: to buy  a sack of Irish potatoes, some pieces of chicken, 10 kilos of meat and increase stock on the soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Mesalimu

texts.en:
Mesalimu is a 26-year-old married woman. She has 2 children aged 3 and 5. She describes herself as an honest woman. 

She operates a a food stall where she sells food and snacks. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located in a viable area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of a place of operation. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to purchase more ingredients for preparing food to sell. 

Mesalimu's business goal is to run a bigger food stall within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will get her children well-educated.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for preparing food to sell.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 40 years old and a business lady. She is the single mother of three children aged 15, 13 and 10 years respectively. 

She has been selling cereals for the past six years with a monthly income of KES 20,000, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan term from KADET LTD, after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Catherine will use the loan to buy dry maize and beans for her business. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and build a store for her grains.

loans.use: To buy dry maize and beans for her business.

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
This is Jonalyn, she is 29 and a resident of Tanza, Cavite City, Philippines. Her husband is Sonny and he is a painter. She is the mother of three children. 

She, together with her husband and children, manages her own household, while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Jonalyn operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php 5 worth of cooking oil or an egg. 

She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 350 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 12,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Jonalyn hopes that her business will grow into a mini-grocery and dreams to be able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. 

She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 34 years old and married with two children. 

He does welding to earn a living. He has been in this business for four years and employs three people. 

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his income and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for 60,000 Kenya Shillings to buy a welding machine.

loans.use: To buy a welding machine

loans.name: Jamelie

texts.en:
This is Jamelie. She is 56 and a resident of Tanza, Cavite City, Philippines. She is a widow with two children. 

She, together with her children, manages her own household, while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Jamelie operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php 5 worth of cooking oil or an egg. 

She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 350 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 8,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Jamelie hopes her business will grow more in the coming year and dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a 33-year-old man from Kisumu city in the western part of Kenya. He is married to Norah and they have three children aged six, four and two years old.

Patrick operates a hotel and has been in this business for the last eight years. He has been making a monthly profit of 16,000 KES. He is taking his first loan from KADET and will use it to purchase utensils for his hotel. He will use the anticipated profits by plowing them back into the business.

His desire is to have a good hotel for middle class businesspeople and to meet his family's needs.

loans.use: to buy utensils for his hotel.

loans.name: Goija

texts.en:
Goija is 49 years old. He lives in the Rustavi District of East Georgia with his family: wife, Nazarjet and a 21-year-old daughter. 

Goija heads the family's farming business, which is their only source of income. Goija takes care of milk cows and sheep on the farm. He sells milk locally to dairy products retailers. Goija also sells lambs in the spring. The family's total average monthly income is 1000 Laris.

Goija requested credit to purchase food for the cows. When the cows are fed with high quality, natural food, their milking capacity will increase and the sales of milk will grow as well and so the family will get more income. 

Goija plans to reinvest part of the increased income in the family farm and the other part will be used for satisfying the family's daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase food for cows

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Ivan

texts.ru:
Иван занимается выращиванием ранних овощей вот уже 8 лет. У него есть свои три большие теплицы, а также теплица для рассадды. Кроме этого, он берет в аренду еще две теплицы. Таким образом он садит 7,000 растений помидор.
иван трудолюбивый фермер, имеющий желание развивать свой бизнес дальше. 

Иван просит предоставить ему кредит для закупки семян, пленки, удодрений, а также ремонта теплиц. Полученну прибыль планирует пустить в бизнес. На следующий год Иван планирует выкупить арендуемый участок земли (на котором уже стоит две теплицы). 

Иван живет с матерью, которая уже в преклоном возрасте и много болеет. В прошлом году она перенесла сложную операцию и не может помогать Ивану по хозяйству. Иван справляется сам, ему нравится тепличный бизнес, так как он приносит хорошую прибыль.
texts.en:
Ivan has been growing early vegetables for 8 years already.  He owns three large greenhouses, as well as a greenhouse for seedlings.  Additionally, he is also renting two more greenhouses.  Altogether, he cultivates close to 7,000 tomato plants.  Ivan is a hardworking farmer, who has the desire to further develop his business.
Ivan is asking for a loan to buy seeds, films, fertilizers, and also to perform some repairs on his greenhouses.  He is planning to invest his profits in the business.  Next year, he is thinking of buying the plot of land that he currently leases (and on which he rents two greenhouses).
Ivan lives with his elderly mother who is very ill.  Last year she underwent a complex surgery and she cannot help Ivan with his business.  Ivan manages by himself.  He likes the greenhouse business, as it brings good profits.

loans.use: to buy seeds, films, fertilizer, and to perform some repairs on his greenhouses.

loans.name: Yanet

texts.es: Yanet de 22 años de edad  convive con Eliseo de 21 años, ellos viven en su casa propia ubicado en el distrito de Llochegua. Yanet es una joven emprendedora con muchos proyectos por realizar, ella tiene una tienda de venta de celulares y accesorios, generalmente trabaja con su querido esposo quien es el encargado de solucionar los problemas que tengan los equipos de sus clientes. Está feliz con su trabajo porque  en poco tiempo de haber aperturado su local ya cuenta con una buena cantidad de clientes. En un futuro desea crecer como negociante y a la vez construir su vivienda para poder vivir en comodidad, pues para lograr ello tiene que trabajar con tenacidad y dedicación, el inconveniente que tiene es la de no contar con local propio y el alquiler les cobra caro. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Yanet esta agradecida a los integrantes de su banco comunal por permitirla acceder al grupo. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles incrementara más celulares y accesorios
texts.en:
Yanet, 22, lives with Eliseo, 21, in their own house in the district of Llochegua.  Yanet is a young entrepreneur with many projects to carry out.  She has a cell phone and accessories shop and generally works with her husband who is in charge of resolving equipment problems for customers.  She is happy with her work because in the short amount time since opening the shop she has attracted a good many customers.

In the future she wants to expand business and maybe build a more comfortable home.  To achieve this she will have to work tenaciously with dedication.  The inconvenience she has is that the space she uses is not her own and the rent is expensive.  This is her first loan through MFP and she is committed to paying it back on time.  Yanet is grateful to the members of her communal bank for allowing her to join the group.  The 1,500 PEN loan will be used to increase her stock of cell phones and accessories.

loans.use: To buy cell phones and accessories.

loans.name: Yrineo

texts.es:
Yrineo de 61 años de edad casado con Delfina de 52 años fruto de esta relación tienen 3 hijos, ellos viven en el distrito de Llochegua. Yrineo es un hombre trabajador dedicado a la agricultura, el cultiva cacao desde hace 40 años en su parcela ubicada en la comunidad de periavente alta. Nos comenta que en toda su trayectoria de agricultor siempre ha tenido problemas en sus cultivos, lo que hizo que él se capacite mejor en el manejo y control de plagas, por lo que ahora su parcela agrícola es un centro demostrativo para las futuras generaciones.
Yrineo está feliz por todo lo que hasta ahora ha logrando gracias al fruto de sus esfuerzos. Su producto los entrega a la acopiadora quien le paga un buen precio, él trabaja juntamente con su querida esposa y su hijo mayor, pero en épocas de cosecha siempre requiere de personales quienes le facilitan en la extracción de los frutos. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete una vez más en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Yrineo esta feliz y conforme con su banco comunal por que todos son puntuales. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles invertirá en contratar peones en su parcela agrícola.
texts.en:
Yrineo, 61, is married to Delfina, 52, and they live with their three children in the district of Llochegua.  Yrineo is a hard-working man who is a farmer.  For 40 years he has been growing cocoa on his patch of land in the Periavente Alta community.  He tells us that throughout his farming experience he has always had problems with his crops, which is what made him learn more about managing and controling crop disease.  Now his cropland is a showcase for future generations.

Yrineo is happy with everything he has achieved thanks to his hard work.  He sells his crops to a collecting company that pays a good price.  He works with his dear wife and eldest son, but always needs extra help to harvest the crop.  This is his second loan through mFP and he is committed to paying it back on time.  Yrineo likes his communal back because all the members are punctual.  He plans to use the 1,500 PEN loan to hire workers for his cropland.

loans.use: To hire workers.

loans.name: Pablo Antonio

texts.es:
Pablo, habita en la comunidad llamada Chacaraseca en las afueras de Leon , es agricultor , de 41 años de edad, casado, padre de tres hijos. El es sencillo pero muy trabajador con solo la primaria aprobada pero que ha salido adelante con lo poco que ha aprendido. Tenia 21 años de edad cuando comenzó a sembrar de manera independiente con herramientas muy artesanales propias del campo, también se dedica ala compra venta de ganado y cerdo.
El requiere el préstamo para reparar areas dañadas de su finca y compra de cerdos para vender.
Pues necesita tener en buenas condiciones su finca para el siguiente ciclo de siembra en la cual va a cultivar maíz, ajonjolí y también criar cerdos de raza para vender,
texts.en:
Pablo lives in the community of Chacaraseca on the outskirts of Leon.  He is a farmer, 41, married and the father of three children.  He is a simple but very hard-working man who only finished elementary school.  But he has known how to get ahead with the little education he received.  He was 21 years old when he began crop farming independently with hand-made farm tools.  He also buys and sells cattle and pigs.

He needs the loan to repair damaged areas of his farmland and to buy pigs to sell.  His farm must be in good condition for the upcoming season when he will plant corn and sesame.  He also wants to raise different breeds of pig to sell.

loans.use: To repair damaged areas of his farmland and buy pigs.

loans.name: Edmundo Roberto

texts.es:
Edmundo, de 33 años de edad, originario de León, casado, de oficio comerciante. Se dedica a la crianza de cerdos gracias el apoyo de sus padres quienes lo motivaron a dedicarse a este negocio incluso fueron ellos los que le dieron cerdos para que empezara a criarlos y vender en las afueras de León. El ha salido adelante poco a poco en medio de su sencillez y escasos recursos el siempre busca la manera de salir adelante, también vende chinelas de hules donde saca una humilde mesa en las afueras de su  casa y comienza a vender y al mismo tiempo vende sus cerdos de desarrollo. De esta manera es que el lleva el alimento a su familia y sostiene los gastos de su hogar. 
El solicita el crédito para la compra de cerdos de desarrollo, el desea ir mejorando su negocio pues uno de sus objetivos es tener cerdos reproductores para vender con los parámetros requeridos por sus clientes.
texts.en:
Edmundo is 33 years old. He is from Leon, married and a merchant. He raises pigs thanks to his parents' support. They motivated him to work in this business and they even gave him the pigs to start raising and sell on the outskirts of Leon. He has gotten ahead little by little. With his humility and scarce resources, he is always looking for a way to get ahead. He also sells rubber flip-flops on a humble table outside his house and he sells the pigs he has raised at the same time. In this way, he feeds his family and pays for his household expenses. 

He is asking for the loan to buy pigs to raise. He wants to improve his business and one of his objectives is to have breeding pigs to sell that meet the parameters required by his customers.

loans.use: to buy pigs to raise.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a twenty-two-year-old married man. He has two children and one is enrolled in school. Ali operates a goat-meat selling business. He's worked in this business for two years. His primary customers are his neighbors. Ali's other source of income includes farming. He describes his greatest business challenge as competition and his highest monthly expenses are food and school fees. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Ali will use the KES 10,000 loan to purchase more goats for resale. Ali aspires to expand his business in the future. He joined Yehu to access funds to expand his business and improve his living standards.

loans.use: To purchase more goats for resale.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity is a married woman. She has a daughter who is one year old. She describes herself as industriuos and innovative. She operates a beauty salon where she provides plaiting, blowdrying and other services and also sells cosmetics. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a viable area and her primary customers are regulars. 

She describes her biggest business challenge as being inadequate funds for improving the beauty salon. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase more cosmetics. Charity's business goal is to increase her customer size within five years. She hopes that in the future, her business will expand.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a forty-six-year-old lady from Kisumu City. She is married to Lucas and they have two children aged twelve and twenty-six. 

Caroline operates a hotel  business, a business she has had for the last ten years. She makes a monthly income of KES 15,000. She is taking a second loan from KADET Ltd. which she will use to buy plastic seats for the hotel business. Her profits will be used to pay school fees for her children.

Her dream is to grow her profits so that she meets her family’s needs fully.

loans.use: To purchase plastic seats for the hotel.

loans.name: Darwing Alberto

texts.es:
Darwin, un joven de 25  años de edad, quien se dedica  a la agricultura, originario de León ,casado padre de un hijo de 6 años de edad. El se independizo de su padre a los 21 años de edad, cuando comenzó a sembrar hortalizas por  su propia cuenta, fue difícil pues comenzó con poco ya que el invertir en siembra de hortalizas requiere mucho capital pero ha salido adelante durante estos 4 años, ha mantenido a su familia.
El realizo el crédito para compra  de insumos para sembrar pipián, maíz y melón. Pues el desea diversificar sus siembra ofrecer productos de muy buena calidad y rendimientos que le permita cubrir los gastos de producción así como ingresos para mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Darwin, 25, is a farmer from León.  He is married and has a 6-year-old son.  At the age of 21 he became independent from his father and began growing vegetables on his own.  It was difficult because he began with very little and growing vegetables requires a lot of capital.  But in these four years he has been able to get ahead and support his family.

He is taking out a loan to buy supplies to plant pumpkin, corn and melon.  He wants to diversify his crop and sell enough high quality produce to cover production costs and obtain enough profit to improve his family's lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy supplies to plant pumpkin, corn and melon.

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es:
Juan ,agricultor de la comunidad Chacaraseca en las afueras de León , 39 años de edad, soltero ,tiene mas de 10 años de dedicarse a esta actividad la cual aprendió de sus padres que se dedicaban a la sierra y crianza de ganado y cerdos. El hizo su primera siembra  a los 19 años de edad, luego fue adquiriendo mas experiencia hasta lograr ser independientes de sus padre.
Actualmente siembra hortalizas, granos básico y se dedica a la crianza de cerdos para vender. El realizo el crédito para compra de cerdos. Pues la venta y crianza de cerdos es una actividad que genera buenos ingresos los cuales utiliza para para los costos de producción, invertir en siembra de ajonjolí, yuca , maíz cultivos que piensa sembrar próximamente y rabien quiere incrementar su ventas de cerdo de raza y ganado.
texts.en:
Juan is a farmer from the Chacaraseca community on the outskirts of León.  He is 39, single and has been in agriculture for over ten years.  He learned the trade from his parents who used to raise cattle and pigs.  He planted his first crop when he was 19 and gained more experience before becoming independent from his father.

Currently, he is growing vegetables and basic grains as well as and raising pigs to sell.  He has requested a loan to buy pigs since this is a business that generates a good income, which he uses to cover production costs and will invest in planting sesame, yucca and corn for the upcoming season.  He also wants to increase the sale of pigs and cattle.

loans.use: To buy pigs.

loans.name: Niño Jesús Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre Niño Jesus se conformó en diciembre del año pasado, con mucho esfuerzo ya  se encuentran en el 3° ciclo,  y comentan que están muy contentas con el apoyo de la fundación paraguaya, pues les ha sido muy útil su ayuda.
La de la Sra. Tomasa es una de las miembros, ella se dedica a la venta de leche, sabanas y gallinas y  nos comenta que mediante su trabajo ella ha podido ayudar a su familia y darles lo que necesitan para tener una vida digna. Ella nos comenta que mediante este negocio la economía de la familia mejoró bastante ya que ella mantiene la casa.
 Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de leche, con lo cual podrá abastecerse y tener es stock para hacer frente a los pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The Niño Jesus women's committee was formed in December of last year. With a lot of hard work, they are already in their 3rd cycle and they remark that they are very happy with the support of the Fundación Paraguaya. Their help has been very useful. 

Tomasa is one of the members. She sells milk, sheets and chickens. She tells us that with this work she has been able to help her family and give them what they need to have a dignified life. She remarks that through this business the family's finances have improved considerably, since she supports the home.

She is asking for the loan to buy milk, with which she will have the stock to fill her customers' orders.

loans.use: to buy milk to sell.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is twenty-five years old, a mother of one child. She runs a retail shop to earn a living. She has been in the business for five years and describes her business environment as good because she has many regular customers. 

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to save her income and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for a loan of 50,000 Kenya Shillings to buy sugar, cooking fat, baking powder and maize flour.

loans.use: To buy sugar, cooking fat, baking powder and maize flour.

loans.name: Boniface

texts.en:
Boniface is thirty years old. An enterprising business man, he is single and supports his parents. He has been a shoe-maker for the past five years with a monthly income of KES 9,000 which he uses to cater for his basic needs.

He is applying for his first loan from KADET Ltd., after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Boniface will use the loan to buy leather materials for making shoes. With the anticipated profit from the business he will employ other workers. 

His hopes and dreams are to open a retail shop for his mother and buy a piece of land and build rental houses which will be signed over to his father.

loans.use: To buy leather materials for making shoes.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is a forty-two-year-old lady from Siaya County. She is married to Michael and they have one child aged twenty-seven.

Pamela operates a second-hand clothes selling business. She has had the business for the last three years and makes a monthly income of KES 17,000. She is taking her first loan from KADET Ltd. which she will use to buy bales of clothes to sell. Her profits will be used to educate her nephew.

Her dream is to grow her profits so that she meets her family’s needs fully.

loans.use: To buy bales of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Winifred

texts.en:
Winifred is a thirty-six-year-old lady. She is a widow from Kisumu City in the Western part of Kenya and has three children aged forteen, twelve and ten. 

She operates a second-hand clothes business. She has been doing this business for the last ten years and makes a monthly profit of KES 15,000. She is taking her first loan with KADET Ltd. which she will use to purchase a stock of skirts, blouses and children's clothes. She will use the anticipated profit to expand her business and venture into rice supply.

Her hope is making her business grow into a wholesale and provide for he family.

loans.use: To buy bales of clothing for sale.

loans.name: Sammy

texts.en:
Sammy is forty-two years old. An enterprising business man, he is married to Ruth, a business lady. They are blessed with one child aged two. 

For the past four years, Sammy has been running a motorcycle transport business as a primary business and green grocer business as a secondary business. His monthly income is KES 9,000 which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan from KADET Ltd., after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Sammy will use the loan to buy a new motorbike and green vegetables. 

With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his child. His hopes and dreams are to buy a taxi car which will help him improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike and green vegetables.

loans.name: Cornelius

texts.en:
Cornelius is 33 years old and a retail shop proprietor in Voi.  He is married. He has been running this business for the past two years with success. 

This is his third business loan from KADET LTD to finance his business. With the loan, he plans to purchase more sugar, rice, tea leaves and cooking oil. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his shop further. 

He hopes to have a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase more sugar, rice, tea leaves and cooking oil

loans.name: San Rafael Group

texts.es:
El comité “SAN RAFAEL” se encuentra en el décimo octavo ciclo del programa de Mujeres Emprendedoras de la Fundación Paraguaya, tiene 21 integrantes y todas ellas se esfuerzan día a día para poder darle a sus familias la posibilidad de un mañana distinto y mejor del que a ellas toco vivir.
Rosalinda es una de las miembros y nos cuenta que se dedica a la venta de carteras y zapatos, en lo cual le va muy bien. Ella dice que tiene pasta para la venta y que eso le ayuda mucho Gracias a la buena calidad de los productos que tiene ha podido formarse una clientela definida, lo cual la ayuda a mantener su hogar.
Ella solicita la ayuda de Kiva y de fundación paraguaya para la compra de carteras y zapatos de todo tipo, con lo cual podrá abastecerse y cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en: The SAN RAFAEL committee finds itself in its 18th cycle of the Mujeres Emprendedoras de la Fundación Paraguaya programme (Women Entrepreneurs of the Paraguayan Foundation). It has 21 members, all of whom work day by day to be able to give their families the possibility of a better life for tomorrow. Rosalinda is one of those members and she tells us how she works selling wallets and shoes, which is going very well for her. She says that she is good at selling and this helps her a lot. Thanks to the good quality of her products, she has been able to form a steady customer base, which helps her to maintain her home. She is asking for help from Kiva and the Paraguayan Foundation to buy wallets and shoes of all types so she can buy more stock and meet the demands of her customers.

loans.use: To buy wallets and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is a fifty-six-year-old farmer from the village Kachreti, East Georgia. He is married and lives with his family: his wife – Aniko, his twenty-three-year-old son and twenty-two-year-old daughter. Alex’s wife and son are farmers as well, and his daughter is a student. 

The family has a milk cow. They also have three pigs and three calves on their farm. Alex sells milk and piglets. Along with the abovementioned the family owns a vineyard. Alex sells grapes on local market. The total average monthly income of the family is 600 Laris. 

Alex requested credit to purchase fertilizer for the vineyard. After proper cultivation and fertilization Alex will get good harvest next fall and sell it for a convenient price. It will positively impact the income of the family. Alex and Aniko will be able to purchase new household goods, to improve family living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for the vinayard.

loans.name: Nzuki

texts.en:
Nzuki is a twenty-five-year-old single man. He has been a charcoal distributor for the past two years with a monthly income of KES 10,000 which he uses to cater for his basic needs. 

He is applying for his second loan term from KADET Ltd., after repaying the previous loan successfully. Nzuki will use the loan to buy sacks of charcoal. 

With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to build a store for his stock.

loans.use: To buy sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is a forty-one-year-old man who has a business producing groundnuts. He has been doing this for two years now. He has four children and a wife and lives in Kagadi, Uganda.

Godfrey first operated a retail shop and then became involved in farming where he got the money to start the production business. He faces a problem of high fuel costs which in turn increases the transport costs. He dreams of educating his children and diversifying his business to include beans and maize. Godfrey wants a loan to buy groundnuts to sell.

loans.use: to buy groundnuts to sell.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a thirty-seven-year-old lady from Kisumu City. She is married to Francis and they have four children aged between eight and fourteen. 

Janet operates a second hand clothes selling business. She has been doing this business for the last ten years and makes a monthly income of KES 15,000. She is taking her first loan from KADET Ltd. which she will use to buy two bales of clothes for resale. Her profits will be used to venture into the sale of new clothing.

Her dream is to grow her profits so that she meets her family’s needs fully.

loans.use: To buy two bales of clothing.

loans.name: Pheobe

texts.en:
Pheobe is thirty-four years old, a single mother from Kisumu city in the western part of Kenya. She has four children aged sixteen, thirteen, twelve and three months.

She operates a fruit selling business. She has been doing this for the last sixteen years and makes a monthly profit of KES 18,000. 

She will use the loan to purchase a stock of passion fruit, oranges and paw paws. She will use the anticipated profit to purchase a blending machine. She dreams of opening a middle-class hotel and providing for her children fully.

loans.use: To buy a variety of fruits to sell.

loans.name: Jarryson

texts.en: Jarryson is thirty-three years old, married, with two children. He sells clothes to earn a living. He has been in the business for five years and describes his business environment as good because there is limited competition. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to grow his business and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for a loan of 50,000 Kenya Shillings to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is a twenty-eight-year-old woman from Lambwe region in the western part of Kenya. She is married to John and they have two children aged two and six. 

Pamela operates a cereal selling business, a business she has been doing for the last eight years. She makes a monthly income of KES 6,000. She is taking her first loan from KADET Ltd. which she will use to buy maize cereals. She will use her profits to buy more stock of maize.

Her dream is to expand her business so that she makes more profits.

loans.use: To buy more stock of maize cereal.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a thirty-five-year-old married man with four children living in Kagadi, Uganda. 

He operates a produce business dealing in beans and maize which he buys from farmers at a low price and sells in town at slightly higher price. He started from farming on a small scale then started this produce business which he has operated for two years now. He has a challenge of inadequate capital to meet the high demand and his dream is a food store. Joseph wants a loan to buy maize and beans to sell.

The other person wearing a white shirt in the photo is a loan officer.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua is a 35-year-old businessman, and he is married to Mary. They are blessed with one child. He has been selling clothes for the past five years with the monthly income of about KES 9,000 which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan term from KADET LTD after being introduced by an existing KADET customer.  Joshua will use the loan to buy a stock of clothes.

With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to rent a house and to sell his clothes without walking around.

loans.use: To buy a stock of clothes to sell.

loans.name: La Cuadrita De Mi Barrio Group

texts.es:
El comité “LA CUADRITA DE MI BARRIO” se encuentra en el décimo primer ciclo del programa de Mujeres Emprendedoras con 17  integrantes, quienes son todas amigas y vecinas de la ciudad de Asunción. Ellas son mujeres muy trabajadoras y luchadoras que día a día se esfuerzan por dar lo mejor a sus familias.
Juana comenta que trabaja en la costura hace ya un buen tiempo, por lo que ya tiene una buena clientela, lo cual le ayuda a poder salir adelante y ayudar a su familia. Ella se define como una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora que se esfuerza al máximo por poder brindar a su familia todo lo que necesitan para una vida digna.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de telas, hilos, botones, cierres y demás insumos para poder seguir trabajando y de esa forma poder cumplir también con los pedidos que tiene.
texts.en:
The CUADRITA DE MI BARRIO committee finds itself in the 11th cycle of the Mujeres Emprendedoras programme (Women Entrepreneurs). It has 17 members, all of whom are friends and neighbours in the city of Asuncion. They are hardworking and determined women who work day by day to provide the best for their families.

Juana tells us that she has worked as a seamstress for a long time now, through which she already has a good client base. This helps her to get ahead and to help her family. She describes herself as a very hardworking woman who pushes herself to the limit to be able to give her family everything they need for a decent life. She is asking for a loan to buy fabric, thread, buttons, closures and other items to be able to continue working and to meet the orders she has.

loans.use: To buy fabric, thread, buttons, closures and other items.

loans.name: Mujeres Al Poder Group

texts.es:
Mujeres al poder es el grupo formado por 18 mujeres de la ciudad de Asunción, todas ellas son amigas y vecinas de esa ciudad. Se decidieron a formar parte del programa de mujeres emprendedoras para que de esa forma puedan ayudarse las unas a las otras y mejorar sus estilos de vida y la de sus familias.
Gladys es una de las miembros del grupo, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora, quien nos comenta que se dedica a la elaboración y venta de comestibles de todo tipo, como ser empanadas, sandwish, y demás tipo, con lo cual ha podido mantener y ayudar a su familia. Ella sueña con tener un local donde poder vender las comidas que hace y de esa forma poder seguir creciendo.
Ella solicita el crédito para abastecerse con carne, panificados, condimentos y demás insumos para poder seguir haciendo los alimentos que vende. Agradece a la fundación y a kiva por la oportunidad que está recibiendo.
texts.en:
'Mujeres al Poder' (Women in Power) is a communal bank of 18 women, all friends and neighbors, in the city of Asunción. They decided to join the program for female entrepreneurs so that they can help each other and improve their lifestyles for themselves and for their families.

Gladys is one of the group members. She is a very hardworking and enterprising woman, who explains that she makes and sells all kinds of food such as empanadas and sandwiches, among others. She has been maintaining and supporting her family through her business, and dreams of having a premises where she can sell her dishes and thus continue to grow.

Gladys is seeking a loan to stock up on meat, bread, condiments and other supplies to be able to keep producing the food that she sells. She is thankful to the foundation and to Kiva for the opportunity she is receiving.

loans.use: to purchase meat, bread, condiments and other supplies for food production

loans.name: Dala

texts.en:
Dala is 57 years old. She lives in the village of Kalauri, East Georgia. She is married and lives with her family: a 26-year-old daughter, 23-year-old son and her mother-in-law (retired). Dala is leading the agricultural business of the family, which is the main source of income for them. Her son and daughter are also actively involved in the family business. 

The family has a milk cow. Dala produces cheese and sells it locally. Also they have piglets, which will be sold after a couple of months. Along with the above mentioned, the family owns 0.1 hectare of land where strawberries are grown. The harvested berries are sold on the local market. The total average monthly income for the family is about 800 Laris. 

Dala requested credit for purchasing additional piglets. She will grow them and sell them in the summer for a higher price. It will give additional income to the family. Dala plans to use the increased income for building a new, bigger cattle-shed, which will allow them to keep more cows on the family farm.

loans.use: to purchase piglets for expansion of the family pig farm.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a twenty-seven-year-old man from Homabay Town and is married to Maurine. They have three school-going children.

He operates a motorcycle transport business, a business he has run for the last four years, making a monthly income of about KES 7,000. He is taking his first loan from KADET LTD which he will use to buy motorcycle spare parts. He plans to use the profits to educate his children.

His dream is to enlarge his business and become profitable.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy maize for resale.

loans.name: Enkhtuya

texts.en:
Enkhtuya is a 44-year-old widow who lives with her 11-year-old son in an outer ger district of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia, without basic infrastructure. Though she is specialized as a pharmacist, she supports her family by operating a used shoe sale business at the largest outdoor market of Mongolia. 

She has been operating her current business since 2001 and her income ranges from about 103,000 to 480,000 Mongolian Tugriks (MNT) in a day. In the winter season her business is popular with poor families, so she needs more products to sell. Thus, she is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase a variety of used shoes to sell for the upcoming traditional Mongolian holiday.

loans.use: to buy a variety of used shoes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy maize for resale.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a 34-year-old married woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 4 to 12 years. She describes herself to be God-fearing and humble. She operates a retail store where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a strategic area and her primary customers are women. She describes her biggest business challenge to be having an inadequate stock of clothes for resale. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase more clothes to sell. Grace's business goal is to run a boutique within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will buy an estate for rental house services.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes for selling in her boutique.

loans.name: Grasiela

texts.es:
Grasiela, de 43 años, es una mujer amable, buena y trabajadora. Está casada con Lester de 41 años y tienen dos hijos de 11 Erlita y Heidy de 13 años. Juntos viven en una casa propia en donde día a día comparten la alegría de estar juntos y unidos, además los deseos de tener una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo de Grasiela consiste en la siembra de productos como el cacao y el maíz, tiene un mercado muy bien ganado en ambos productos ya que el maíz lo vende a los molinos procesadores de alimentos balanceados y el cacao a los comerciantes que posteriormente los venden a las fabricas de chocolates. Tiene un total de 9 hectáreas de terreno y solo  utiliza 4, por lo tanto tiene más terreno por sembrar. Por ello se encargará de darle la fertilizanción necesaria para que la tierra este preparada. En sus siete años de trabajo se ha convertido en un experto.
Lo que mas considera importante, es que su esposo siempre esta a su lado apoyándola ya que el trabajo lo realizan juntos como un equipo, le esta yendo bien aunque desea poder crecer mas y brindar mejores condiciones de vida a sus hijos, tanto en educación y alimentación. Este será el crédito número 3 con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero para poder continuar aumentando su capital de trabajo, además esta convencida que seguirá siendo la socia buena y responsable de los créditos obtenidos anteriormente. Le gusta pertenecer al banco comunal al que trabaja ya que todos son responsables y muy solidarios entre si. Con el monto solicitado 2000 soles, comprará abono para fertilizar el resto de hectáreas que tiene sin producir, además de algunos materiales y herramientas necesarias como machees y palas.
texts.en:
Grasiela, 43, is a kind and hardworking woman. She is married to Lester, 41, and has two children - Erlita is11 and Heidy is 13. They live together in their own home, where every day they share in the joy of being together and united, however they wish for a better quality of life. 

Grasiela farms produce such as cocoa and corn. She has a very good market for both products as corn is sold to processing mills, and the cocoa to traders who then sell them to chocolate factories. She has a total of 9 acres, however she only uses 4 and therefore has more land for planting. She needs to fertilize this land to prepare it for use. Grasiela's seven years of experience have made her an expert in her work. For Grasiela, the most important thing is that her husband is always by her side to support her, as the work is done together as a team. They are doing well, but they want to grow more and provide a better life for their children, in both education and diet. 

This will be Grasiela's third loan with MFP, and she is very happy to know that she has financial support which allows her to continue to increase her working capital. Furthermore, she is certain that she will remain a good member, and has been responsible for the loans received previously. 

She likes belonging to the communal bank, because everyone is responsible and very supportive of each other. With the 2000 soles requested, Grasiela will buy manure to fertilize the rest of the land that is currently not in use, in addition to some materials and tools such as machetes and shovels.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizer and tools for cultivating the land.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase garments, shoes, sandals, blouses, shirts, cosmetics and other products.

loans.name: Annalyline

texts.en:
Annalyline is a married lady whose age is 44. She is blessed with five children, ages 18, 16, 14, 10 and 8. She owns a farm in Kapsabet, which has been in operation for more than 10 years. She earns a monthly income of KES 15,000.

Annalyline is servicing her third loan of KES 70,000 from KADET LTD. She successfully repaid her previous loans and wishes to use this amount to purchase farm inputs and also to expand the land for tilling. The anticipated profit will be used to pay her children's school fees and she will also put money back into the business.

Her dream is to prosper in her farm and improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and to expand the land for tilling.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 60-year-old businesswoman from Vihiga. She is a widow who takes care of four children.

Mary sells maize cereals and has been running this business for the last four years. She makes a monthly income of KES 12,500. She is taking her fourth loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy more maize cereals to boost her current stock. She will use the anticipated profits to provide for her family’s basic needs.

Her dream is to expand her business and to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more maize cereals to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the cost of mulching coffee and also to prepare his land.

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es: Guillermo, de 46 años, es un hombre amable y muy trabajador, es soltero y no tiene hijos y vive solo en su casa propia, tiene la responsabilidad de mantener a sus padres y por ello es que todos los días trabaja mucho para darles un vejez tranquila. Cuando en la localidad en donde vive Guillermo alguien necesita movilizarse de una lugar a otro, siempre esta él ahí a la espera de sus eventuales pasajeros que en la mayoría de los casos son conocidos. Gracias a su buen trato, y sobre todo con la responsabilidad que el hace su trabajo es que las personas buscan siempre lo buscan. Lleva realizando éste trabajo por 3 años y es un trabajo que le gusta mucho ya que le permite tener tiempo para poder estar al pendiente de sus padres. Le esta yendo bien hasta el momento, pero considera importante tener los documentos en Regla para dar mayor seguridad a sus clientes. Espera mas adelante comprar una mototaxi mas y así tener un ingreso adicional alquilándolo. Este será el préstamo número 3 con MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos, además se compromete una vez mas de cumplir con sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos recibidos; esta muy contento de pertenecer a su grupo, ya que el es fundador y siempre esta en espera que les vaya bien ya que lucharon mucho para consolidarlo y mantenerse como buenos clientes. Con el monto solicitado 1000 soles, comprará repuestos y piezas para la refacción de su vehiculo ya que la zona no hay pistas y eso hace que se deteriore rápidamente.
texts.en:
Guillermo, 46, is a friendly and hardworking man. He's single with no children, and he lives alone in his own house. He is responsible for looking after his parents, so he works very hard every day to make sure they are comfortable in their own age. When someone in Guillermo's neighbourhood needs to move from one place to another, he is always there ready to help his passengers, who in the majority of cases are acquaintances of his. Thanks to his pleasant manner, and above all because of the responsible attitude with which he carries out his work, he is always the one people go to. He has been doing this work for three years and enjoys it very much as it allows him time to be able to be there for his parents.

Things are going well for him at the moment, but it's important for Guillermo to have his documents in order to give better security to his customers. He hopes in the future to be able to buy another mototaxi and to earn an additional income by hiring it out. This will be his third loan with MFP, with which he hopes to continue working towards his goals. He also promises once again to meet his payments on time, as he has in the past with the other loans he has received. He is very happy being part of his group; he is the founder and always hopes that things go well for them as they work hard to grow stronger and to keep on being good customers. With the loan of 1000 soles he has requested, he will buy parts to repair his vehicle, as in his neighbourhood there are no roads, which means it gets damaged quickly.

loans.use: To buy parts to fix his motorbike.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 27 years old. He lives in the village of Kachreti in East Georgia with his family, which includes his wife, Nina, their two children (ages 2 and 3) and his father. George owns a small butcher’s store, where he sells meat. Also, the family has a milk cow. Nina produces cheese and sells it locally. Additionally, the family owns 20 bee-hives. They sell harvested honey locally. The total average monthly income of the family is 800 GEL. 

George has requested credit to fulfill a new business initiative. He plans to purchase potatoes for sowing on a family-owned plot of land. In the summer, he will sell harvested potatoes and earn additional income. George and Nina will use the increased income to purchase additional household goods and to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes for sowing on a family-owned plot of land.

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es:
Maria Antonia tiene 45 años de edad, es casada hace 9 años, su esposo trabaja como guardia de seguridad en una empresa privada, tiene 2 hijos de 8 y 3 años de edad, y vive con su familia en la Aldea Santa Lucia, Cofradía, Cortes.
Maria tiene un negocio de pulpería y venta de mercadería, su negocio lo estableció hace 20 años con su propio capital, y vende productos de la canasta básica como  frijoles, arroz, azúcar, harina, sal, refrescos, lácteos  etc, y también ofrece a sus clientes la venta de  sandalias y ropa de mujer y hombre. Ella dedica todo el día a su negocio. 
Doña Maria lleva 4 préstamos con Odef, y actualmente solicita su quinto préstamo para invertir en la compra de producto  como jabón, productos de limpieza, pastas dentales, fósforos, papel de baño, condimentos etc., y en la compra de mercadería como sandalias y ropa de vestir para la venta.
Su meta es crecer más en su negocio y así obtener mejores ingresos para reinvertir comprando más producto y mejorar las condiciones de de vida para su familia.
texts.en:
Maria Antonia, age 45, has been married for nine years.  Her husband works as a security guard for a private company.  She has two children, ages eight and three.  She lives with her family in the village of Santa Lucia, Cofradía, Cortes.

Maria has a grocery business, and she sells merchandise.  She established her business 20 years ago with her own money.  She sells staples like beans, rice, sugar, flour, salt, soft drinks, and dairy products, etc.  She also sells sandals for women and men.  She devotes the whole day to her business.

Maria has had four loans with ODEF.  She is currently requesting her fifth loan to buy products like soap, cleaning products, toothpaste, matches, toilet paper, and condiments, etc.  She will also buy merchandise like sandals and clothes.  Her goal is to grow her business more.  That way she will get better income in order to reinvest by purchasing more products.  She will do this to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy groceries and merchandise (soap, cleaning products, toilet paper, tooth paste, condiments, sandals, and clothes).

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a businesswoman who sells clothes to earn a living. She has been in this business for 25 years and has employed five people. 

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Mary has been able to expand her business and hopes to be financially stable in the future. She has applied for a 50,000 KES loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy clothes for sale.

loans.name: Julissa Yolanda

texts.es:
Julissa tiene 21 años de edad, es casada hace 6 años, tiene un hijo de 2 años de edad, y vive en el barrio Lempira, Tela Atlántida.
Julissa tiene su propio negocio de pulpería que inicio hace 6 meses con la ayuda de sus padres los cuales le facilitaron el capital para poder iniciarlo, vende  productos de la canasta básica como frijoles, arroz, azúcar, harina, maseca, refrescos, lácteos, embutidos, golosinas, galletas, pan y carnes.
Ha tenido demanda en las ventas ya que en la zona no hay muchos negocios de pulpería.
Es su primer préstamo con Odef y lo necesita para surtir de producto comprando más, arroz, frijoles, azúcar, harina, maseca, refrescos, lácteos, embutidos y carnes.
Su meta en el futuro es crecer con su negocio, y tener mas demanda de clientes obteniendo más ingresos y ayudar a satisfacer las necesidades básicas de su hogar.
texts.en:
Julissa, age 21, has been married for six years, and she has a two year old child.  She lives in the Lempira neighborhood, Tela Atlántida.

Julissa has her own business, a grocery store.  She started the business six months ago with help from her parents, who provided the capital to be able to do so.  She sells staples like beans, rice, sugar, flour, “maseca” (instant corn dough), soft drinks, dairy products, sausages, soft drinks, cookies, bread, and meat.  There has been demand for her sales because there are not many grocery stores in the area.

This is her first loan with ODEF.  She needs it to stock more products like rice, beans, sugar, maseca, soft drinks, dairy products, sausages, and meat.

Her goal for the future is for her business to grow and to have more customer demand.  She will then get more income, which will help meet the basic needs of her household.

loans.use: to buy products like rice, beans, sugar, maseca, soft drinks, dairy products, sausages, and meat.

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es:
Don José Manuel tiene 60 años de edad, es casado hace 39 años, tiene un hijo de de 17 años de edad y vive con su familia en el barrio Suyapa, Tela, Atlantida.

Don José Manuel debido a su situación, por falta de una oportunidad de trabajo, decidió establecer su negocio propio (pulpería), de venta de productos alimenticios de primera necesidad como granos básicos (arroz, sal, azúcar, manteca, carne de pollo refrescos, churros, galletas, gelatinas, pan, cornflakes, salsina y medicamentos. Este negocio tiene 5 años  gracias a su buena administración y la ayuda de su esposa, dedicándole todo el día al negocio.

Con los  financiamientos que a solicitado a ODEF, a logrado incrementar su inventario, en la actualidad solicita otro préstamo para invertir en la compra de granos básicos(arroz,    frijoles,azúcar,harina,maseca,refrescos,lacteos,carne de pollo) para aumentar y mejorar sus ventas de donde está sacando sus ingresos para vivir mejor con su familia

Su meta a seguir es tener un supermercado para poder satisfacer con los productos necesarios la demanda de clientes.
texts.en:
José Manuel, age 60, has been married for 39 years and has a 17 year old child.  He lives with his family in the Suyapapa neighborhood, Tela, Atlantida.

Due to the lack of opportunity for work, José Manuel decided to establish his own business (grocery store).  He sells staple food products like basic grains, rice, salt, sugar, lard, chicken, soft drinks, churros, cookies, gelatin, bread, cornflakes, tomato sauce, and medicines.  He has had this business for five years thanks to his good administration and the help from his wife, devoting all day to the business.

With the loans that he has requested from ODEF he has managed to increase his inventory.  He is currently requesting another loan to buy basic grains, rice, beans, sugar, flour, maseca, soft drinks, dairy products, and chicken in order to increase and improve his sales.  He is taking his income in order to live better with his family.

His goal is to have a supermarket in order to have the necessary products to meet customer demand.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, rice, beans, sugar, flour, maseca, soft drinks, dairy products, and chicken.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel, de 52 años es un hombre bueno, amable y muy trabajador, esta casado con Luz Marina de 40 años y con quien tiene cuatro hijos, de los cuales uno ya es mayor e independiente, y los menores son Eneida de 13, Meybi de 8 y Eigel de 4. Él vive a lado de su familia en su casa propia, inmueble que pudo comprar gracias a mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio. El trabajo de Isabel consiste en le venta de comida, tiene un puesto en el mercado de su localidad en donde va diariamente muy temprano en busca de los mejores ingredientes y las carnes mas fresas para así empezar su día laboral y poder dar lo mejor a sus clientes.  Lleva realizando este trabajo por 1 año y tiene la ayuda de sus hijos y de su esposa. Hasta hace 2 años se dedicaba a la refacción de zapatos en un pequeño local que tenia pero lamentablemente la vista le empezó a fallar y con eso tuvo que buscar otra manera de obtener ingresos para su familia, ahora decidió empezar con este trabajo que le permite tener algunos ingresos para la tranquilidad de su hogar, tiene muchos planes en mente pero lo que mas desea ahora es poder mantener su negocio y hacerlo crecer poco a poco, es un trabajo muy duro pero esta dispuesto a emprenderlo. Este será el crédito número 2 con MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos, por otro lado se compromete una vez mas a pagar de manera puntual y responsable todas sus cuotas. 
Con el monto solicitado de 1500 soles, comprará ingredientes no perecibles, además de invertir en algunos muebles que le hacen falta para atender con mayor comodidad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Isabel is 52 years old. He is a good, friendly and very hardworking man. He is married to Luz Marina who is 40 years old. They have four children. One is now older and independent. The younger ones are 13 year old Eneida, eight year old Meybi and four year old Eigel. He lives with his family in their own house that he could buy thanks to lots of effort and sacrifice. 
Isabel sells food. He has a stall in his town’s market. He goes very early every day to find the best ingredients and the freshest meats in order to start his work day and to give his customers the best. He has been doing this work for one year and he wife and children help him. Up until two years ago, he did shoe repairs in a small business that he had. But unfortunately, his sight started to fail and he had to find another way to earn money for his family. 
He decided to start with this work that allows him to have some earnings for his family's tranquility. He has many plans in his mind but what he wants most right now is to be able to maintain his business and make it grow little by little. It is very hard work but he is willing to undertake this job. This will be loan number two with MFP. Therefore, he hopes to continue with this collaboration. On the other hand, he promises once again to pay on time and to be responsible with all of his payments.
With a total loan requested of 1500 soles, he will buy nonperishable ingredients. In addition, he will invest in some needed furniture to serve his customers with more comfort.

loans.use: purchase nonperishable foods to stock his business and furniture to make his stand more welcoming.

loans.name: Yacine

texts.fr:
Yacine est une femme mariée âgée de 60 ans et mère de 6 enfants.
Elle est membre du banc villageois depuis son cycle 2.

Madame fait partie du groupe de solidarité AND JEF, son activité se trouve être le commerce de détails par la vente de de couscous  et de farine de mil et de légumes:

Yacine a une bonne expérience dans son domaine d'activité pour l'avoir exercé depuis plusieurs années.

Grace à son nouveau crédit de 350.000 CFA Elle va se procurer de la marchandise (mil) qu'elle va transformer en couscous et revendre au niveau du petit marché de son village.

Madame Yacine nous informe que ses bénéfices lui permettront de prendre en charge ses besoins personnels et ceux de sa famille toute entière.
texts.en:
Mrs. Yacine is a 60-year old woman and the mother of six.

She has been a member of the “Banc Villageois” since her second-cycle loan. Mrs. Yacine belongs to the And Jef solidarity group. Her line of business is retailing couscous, millet flour and vegetables.

She has plenty of experience with this work as she has been doing it  for years.
Thanks to her new loan of 350,000 Central African francs, she will  stock up on millet, which she will use to prepare couscous for sale at the small market in her village.
Mrs. Yacine says that her revenues will allow her to provide for her personal needs as well as for the needs of her whole family.

loans.use: to buy millet in order to prepare couscous for sale.

loans.name: Bayarmaa

texts.en:
Bayarmaa is a 26-year-old woman who lives with her husband and two daughters in Central Mongolia. With the help of her husband, she manages a clothes and grocery-product trading business between Ulaanbaatar city and her sum (a subdivision of a province). She sells all kinds of grocery items and a variety of clothes for all ages. Her husband helps with her business and transports the ordered products. Her daughters stay home with her grandmother. 

In 2005, Bayarmaa started her grocery-product trading business. Her business is really going well and she has been increasing her household income significantly. 

Based on her experience, Bayarmaa would like to extend her business by acquiring supplies in a large amount so she can save on transport expenses. She is a hardworking woman who says,"I would like to extend my business so that I can save and spend it to buy supplies next time." The total amount she is requesting is 1,700,000 MNT to buy products to make foods.

loans.use: To purchase products to make foods.

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es:
Marco, ha iniciado un pequeño negocio de utiles y necesita fortalecer el inventario, por eso solicita un préstamo para la compra de útiles escolares, este nuevo préstamo le ayudara para atender la demanda de los estudiantes ya que ha iniciado el ciclo de estudio, su compra será en cuadernos, lapiceros, marcadores.
Él considera que este préstamo le ayudara para generar mejores ganancias, ayudando aun más a su familia y poder pagar este préstamo, comenta que los prestamos anteriores le ayudaron para cubrir gastos educativos de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Marco has started up a new office supplies business and needs to strengthen the inventory, so he is seeking a loan for the purchase of school supplies. This new loan will help him meet the demand of the students since the new semester has already started. He will purchase notebooks, pens and markers. 

He believes that this loan will help him generate a better income so he may help his family even more and be able to pay off this loan. He comments that the previous loans helped him cover educational costs for his children.

loans.use: to purchase notebooks, pens and markers.

loans.name: Ganbat

texts.en:
Ganbat is 58 years old and lives with his wife and two children in central Mongolia. His wife is unemployed and his son studies at college. 

Ganbat started his business by building a small shop within their fence and in 2005 he extended the business by adding a building. The building consists of two parts -- one half is where he lives and the other half is where he operates his business. 

Ganbat wants to bring supplies in large quantities from the capital city. He is a hardworking man who says, "I want to extend my business by increasing the types of supplies I purchase in large quantities." The total amount he is requesting is 2,400,000 MNT so he can buy supplies for his shop.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for his shop.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine would like to borrow a loan of KES 100,000. This will be her third loan. She repaid the previous loans successfully and wishes to use this amount to purchase more beauty products, perfumes and hair conditioners for her cosmetic sales business.  

The profits will be used to repay the loan and to invest back into the business. She hopes to open a wholesale shop and improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more beauty products, perfumes and hair conditioners for her cosmetic sales business.

loans.name: Lucinda Maribel

texts.es:
Lucinda, se ha decidido a solicitar un nuevo préstamo para la compra de telas, porque necesita comprarse diversidad de colores para confeccionar ropa, esta nueva inversión le ayudara para mejorar la disponibilidad de productos.
Ella ha tenido una bonita experiencia trabajando con nuestra institución, dándole una mejor capacidad y calidad de vida junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Lucinda has decided to request a new loan to buy cloth because she needs to purchase a diversity of colors to make clothing. This new investment will help her improve the availability of products she offers.

Lucinda has had a lovely experience working with our institution, offering her a greater capacity and quality of life together with her family.

loans.use: buy cloth for her dressmaking business.

loans.name: Mapendo Plus Group

texts.en:
Mapendo Plus is a community bank made up of 10 micro-entrepreneurs whose chairwoman is Sylvie. These members are united by the same goal, which is to grow their businesses through loans received from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC.

Sylvie runs a restaurant in the western suburban area of Kinshasa. She is 35 years old and a mother of five children who are between the ages of 1 and 17. Three of them attend school. 

Sylvie started her food-selling business in 1980. With hard work and good management -- and by providing good customer service -- Sylvie’s business has prospered and she has permanent customers to help maintain the business. 

She has already received and successfully repaid nine loans from MFI HOPE DRC. Her business generates $90 of profit per week. With the new loan, Sylvie is planning to increase the inventory of her restaurant to meet customer demands and generate additional profit. Her ambition is to expand her business.

loans.use: to increase the inventory of her restaurant to meet customer demands and generate additional profit.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Jose Adrian

texts.es:
José, se decidió por un nuevo préstamo para  la recolección de la cosecha, por lo necesita pagar la mano de obra para realizar la labor, además una parte de este préstamo servirá para apoyar a su esposa en la venta de pupusas, comprando materiales para su venta.
José considera que el préstamo anterior le sirvió porque ha comprado los insumos para la siembra, esto ha sido un progreso para él.
texts.en:
Jose has decided to request a new loan for harvesting his crops. He will need to pay laborers to carry out the work. In addition, a part of the loan will be used to help his wife sell 'pupusas' (a popular Salvadoran dish) by paying for needed ingredients.

Jose considers his previous loan helpful because he used it to purchase supplies for planting his crop. This  boosted his progress.

loans.use: pay laborers to harvest his crops.

loans.name: Zogbo

texts.en:
Zogbo lives in Airport, Liberia. She is 39 years old and married. She has three children between the ages of 8 and 19 who are in school and live at home. Her husband works at the Robert International Airport. 

For the past 18 years, Zogbo has been selling palm oil in the market. Zogbo says she received a small amount of money from her sister to invest in the business. She enjoys her business because she earns money. 

Zogbo is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil for her business. Her dream is to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Damianus

texts.en:
Damianus is a 33-year-old man who is married to Yohana, a 29-year-old lady. They have two children from their marriage: James, a 7-year-old and Akhilas, 6 years old; both are attending elementary school. 

To generate income for his family, Damianus works as a salesman. He initiated the business four years ago by using his own capital. Damianus purchases stock from the supplier such as shampoo, bath soap, medicines, coffee, milk etc to be distributed from one shop to another. He works from 9 am until all his stock is sold out. He rides his motorbike in running the business every day. 

Recently, Damianus expanded his business by selling a kind of cosmetics but he could not provide all the stock demanded by his customers. He cannot afford to buy the products in large quantity as it is more expensive than the other business stock that he sells. 

Damianus heard that TLM usually provides a loan, particularly for small entrepreneurs like him. Damianus then submitted a loan application to TLM. He is requesting a loan of IDR 4,500,000 to purchase cosmetics such as lipstick, face powder, nail polish, etc. Damianus is hoping that he can get the loan shortly.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics such as lipstick, face powder, nail polish, etc. for his business.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is from the village Bakurtsikhe, East Georgia. He is married and lives with his family: his wife – Marine, his parents and grandparents. He married couple of months ago. George works as a taxi driver. He provides a taxi service to the local population. His father works as a baker. His grandparents are retired and get monthly pension. The total average monthly income of the family is 1,000 Laris. 

George requested credit to purchase a new car to use as a taxi. He will sell his old one and buy a better one. He can provide a higher quality service to his passengers. The number of clients will increase and George will get more income. This will allow the family to spend more on their daily needs and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a car he can use as a taxi.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther lives in Air Port Community. She is 37 years old, married, with five children between four and nineteen. They are all in school and live at home. 

For the past ten years she has been involved in a cook shop business (restaurant). She makes good profit and has lots of customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, pepper, oil, and charcoal for her business. Her plans are to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, pepper, oil, and charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Zaur

texts.en:
Zaur is a fifty-six-year-old farmer from the village of Dzirkoki. He lives with his family: his wife Marine, a thirty-one-year-old son, his daughter-in-law and two grandsons. Agriculture is the primary source of the income for the family. They have 0.8 hectares of land with a peach-garden and a vineyard. The family also grows tomato and cucumbers. Harvested products are sold locally to retailers. The total average monthly income of the family is 1,100 Laris. 

Zaur requested credit to purchase vine saplings to expand the vine-yard. After couple of years the family will harvest and sell more grapes. It will increase their income. Zaur plans to use the increased income to finance the education of his grand-children.

loans.use: to purchase vine saplings.

loans.name: Oretha

texts.en: Oretha is 34 years old and lives in Air Port Community. She is married with five children, ages 10 to 17 years old, that live at home.
